actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States prohibiting corporations and labor organizations from using operating funds for advertisements in connection with any campaign for election for Federal office.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits corporations or labor organizations from using any of their operating funds or any other funds from their general treasuries to make any payment for any advertisement in connection with a campaign for election for federal office, without regard to whether or not the advertisement expressly advocates the election or defeat of a specified candidate in the election.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States prohibiting corporations and labor organizations from using operating funds for advertisements in connection with any campaign for election for Federal office.
